t: Matthew 16
The Pharisees and Sadducees Seek a Sign
Then*p the Pharisees and Sadducees came, and testing Him asked that He would show them a sign from heaven.
He answered and said to them, “When*r it*r is*r evening*r you*r say,*r ‘It*ir will*ir be*ir fair*r weather,*r for*r the*r sky*r is*r red’;*r

and*r in*r the*r morning,*r ‘It*ir will*ir be*ir foul*r weather*r today,*r for*r the*r sky*r is*r red*r and*r threatening.’*r Hypocrites!*r You*r know*r how*r to*r discern*r the*r face*r of*r the*r sky,*r but*r you*r cannot*r discern*ir the*r signs*r of*r the*r times.*r

A*r wicked*r and*r adulterous*r generation*r seeks*r after*r a*r sign,*r and*r no*r sign*r shall*r be*r given*r to*r it*r except*r the*r sign*r of*r the*r prophet*r Jonah.”*r And He left them and departed.
The Leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees
Now*p when His disciples had come to the other side, they had forgotten to take bread.
Then Jesus said to them, “Take*r heed*r and*r beware*r of*r the*r leaven*r of*r the*r Pharisees*r and*r the*r Sadducees.”*r
And*p they reasoned among themselves, saying, “It*i is*i because we have taken no bread.”
But*p Jesus, being aware of it,*i said to them, “O*r you*r of*r little*r faith,*r why*r do*r you*r reason*r among*r yourselves*r because*r you*r have*r brought*r no*r bread?*r
Do*r you*r not*r yet*r understand,*r or*r remember*r the*r five*r loaves*r of*r the*r five*r thousand*r and*r how*r many*r baskets*r you*r took*r up?*r
Nor*r the*r seven*r loaves*r of*r the*r four*r thousand*r and*r how*r many*r large*r baskets*r you*r took*r up?*r
How*r is*r it*r you*r do*r not*r understand*r that*r I*r did*r not*r speak*r to*r you*r concerning*r bread?—*r but*ir to*r beware*r of*r the*r leaven*r of*r the*r Pharisees*r and*r Sadducees.”*r
Then they understood that He did not tell them*i to beware of the leaven of bread, but of the doctrine of the Pharisees and Sadducees.
Peter Confesses Jesus as the Christ
When*p Jesus came into the region of Caesarea Philippi, He asked His disciples, saying, “Who*r do*r men*r say*r that*r I,*r the*r Son*r of*r Man,*r am?”*r
So*p they said, “Some say*i John the Baptist, some Elijah, and others Jeremiah or one of the prophets.”
He*p said to them, “But*r who*r do*r you*r say*r that*r I*r am?”*r
Simon*p Peter answered and said, “You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.”
Jesus*p answered and said to him, “Blessed*r are*r you,*r Simon*r Bar-Jonah,*r for*r flesh*r and*r blood*r has*r not*r revealed*r this*ir to*r you,*r but*r My*r Father*r who*r is*r in*r heaven.*r
And*r I*r also*r say*r to*r you*r that*r you*r are*r Peter,*r and*r on*r this*r rock*r I*r will*r build*r My*r church,*r and*r the*r gates*r of*r Hades*r shall*r not*r prevail*r against*r it.*r

And*r I*r will*r give*r you*r the*r keys*r of*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven,*r and*r whatever*r you*r bind*r on*r earth*r will*r be*r bound*r in*r heaven,*r and*r whatever*r you*r loose*r on*r earth*r will*r be*r loosed*r in*r heaven.”*r
Then*p He commanded His disciples that they should tell no one that He was Jesus the Christ.
Jesus Predicts His Death and Resurrection
From*p that time Jesus began to show to His disciples that He must go to Jerusalem, and suffer many things from the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be killed, and be raised the third day.
Then*p Peter took Him aside and began to rebuke Him, saying, “Far be it from You, Lord; this shall not happen to You!”

But*p He turned and said to Peter, “Get*r behind*r Me,*r Satan!*r You*r are*r an*r offense*r to*r Me,*r for*r you*r are*r not*r mindful*r of*r the*r things*r of*r God,*r but*r the*r things*r of*r men.”*r
Take Up the Cross and Follow Him
Then*p Jesus said to His disciples, “If*r anyone*r desires*r to*r come*r after*r Me,*r let*r him*r deny*r himself,*r and*r take*r up*r his*r cross,*r and*r follow*r Me.*r
For*r whoever*r desires*r to*r save*r his*r life*r will*r lose*r it,*r but*r whoever*r loses*r his*r life*r for*r My*r sake*r will*r find*r it.*r
For*r what*r profit*r is*r it*r to*r a*r man*r if*r he*r gains*r the*r whole*r world,*r and*r loses*r his*r own*r soul?*r Or*r what*r will*r a*r man*r give*r in*r exchange*r for*r his*r soul?*r
For*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r will*r come*r in*r the*r glory*r of*r His*r Father*r with*r His*r angels,*r and*r then*r He*r will*r reward*r each*r according*r to*r his*r works.*r
“Assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r there*r are*r some*r standing*r here*r who*r shall*r not*r taste*r death*r till*r they*r see*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r coming*r in*r His*r kingdom.”*r
